item.title: [MJAVADOC-469] <additionalOption> input isn't escaped for double backslashes in argument file
item.project: Maven Javadoc Plugin (Moved to GitHub Issues)
item.description:
On Windows `generate-rest-docs` goal of `maven-jira-plugin` calls `maven-javadoc-plugin` with:

additionalparam: -output "C:\path\to\target\classes\resourcedoc.xml"

If this argument was passed to `javadoc.exe` directly, I'm pretty sure this would work. However, the javadoc plugin generates an argument file[1] named "options" and executes:

javadoc.exe ... @options

The file contains all arguments with unescaped backslashes, although javadoc command documentation[2] suggests:

If a filename contains embedded spaces, put the whole filename in double quotes, and double each backslash ("My Files
Stuff.java")

javadoc plugin version "2.4" is hardcoded in jira plugin, but I see no related changes in "2.10.4" in AbstractJavadocMojo.addCommandLineOptions() .

[1]: https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-javadoc-plugin/
[2]: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/javadoc.html#argumentfiles

Here's a possible workaround for others having the same problem. It's basically doubling the available backslashes on it's own before forwarding the path as a command line arg. This needs to be done before the path is used by the Maven plugin and written to the argument file, afterwards it's too late. After Javadoc parsed the paths one can't reconstruct the path anymore because the single backslashes just disappear if they have no special meaning in front of character. While "\t" becomes a tab, "\U" just becomes "U" for Javadoc.

	<!-- https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MJAVADOC-469 -->
	<plugin>
		<groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId>
		<artifactId>build-helper-maven-plugin</artifactId>
		<executions>
			<execution>
				<id>create-javadoc-compat-out-dir</id>
				<phase>pre-site</phase>

				</goals>
